Ad Text:
Initial contract until mid March 2026, with a potential extension
Attractive daily pay rate of $ 1000 + super per day
8 hours per day / 40 hours per week
Hybrid work arrangement (50% WFH + 50% in Eveleigh & Parramatta offices)

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE ROLE:

The Technical Business Analyst oversees the implementation of technical business projects and solutions, carries out reviews and analysis of core Department services, processes and identifies changes that lead to business improvements. They contribute technical and thought leadership to the development, implementation, integration and ongoing support of systems and tools to meet end user requirements.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Develop requirements and scope process/systems change proposals and statements to support the Department’s business technologies, systems and tools; ensure compliance with the Department’s approved project management standards, methodologies, tools and/or systems
Create and provide relevant artefacts to manage process in a controlled and governed manner
Carry out data analysis, mappings and transformations considering accepted best business practice
Contribute technical and thought leadership to assist other IT Directorate teams to document requirements; participate in cross-team process improvement to ensure business applications are effectively integrated and maximise the use of existing information, infrastructure and architecture
Prepare test plans and support documentation for systems and tools; lead planning workshops and project teams to capture and define technical requirements and data / information specifications
Contribute to planning processes to ensure timeframes for development, implementation and support take account of project deadlines and constraints; ensure all change management issues are thoroughly researched and resolved prior to implementation
Prepare and deliver presentations and briefings as required; provide management with status of projects and other project related issues as required
Contribute to the project activities including: requirements gathering & creation of user stories, data analysis, testing, and data mapping & data transformations
Contribute to planning /decision-making regarding new and enhanced systems; displays high level analytical skills to accurately and clearly document data mappings for an integration solution, servicing department crown jewel application data to downstream consumers
ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:

Extensive experience as a technical business analyst in a large complex IT environment and a proven ability to deliver complex user specifications and/or detailed business requirements.
Proven experience in Learning Management System projects.
Proven understanding of project and systems development lifecycles and project management and business analysis methodologies (e.g. PRINCE 2, CBAP, Agile).
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to deliver results in a fast paced, high demand, complex project environment.
If this sounds like you, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now 

About Easy Authoring:
Established in 2006, Easy Authoring helps job seekers find the right opportunity to match their skill set and aid career progression. We are the authorized suppliers to NSW, ACT, QLD, and the Federal government as well as multiple corporate organisations to provide contingent labor for various business functions including ICT, Project Management, Change Management, and Learning design along with a broad range of other business-focused positions.

Salary: $1,000 to $1,112 per day inclusive of super
Ad Text:
Our client is a large, NSW government department that provides extensive education services

This a critical role to work on a complete revamp of their Leadership Learning Resource Redesign solution - a new enterprise solution to meet the needs of school leaders; aiding them to develop their leadership capabilities to lead their schools

Role Description:

The Technical Business Analyst will carry out reviews and analysis of core Department services, processes and identify changes that lead to business improvements

The role will contribute technical and thought leadership to the development, implementation, integration and ongoing support of the Leadership Learning Resource solution - in order to meet end user requirements. 

Responsibilities:

Elicit technical requirements
Develop requirements and scope process/systems change proposals and statements
Contribute to the project activities including: requirements gathering & creation of user stories, data analysis, testing, and data mapping & data transformations
Create and provide relevant artefacts to manage process in a controlled and governed manner
Carry out data analysis, mappings and transformations 
Contribute technical and thought leadership to assist other IT teams to document requirements and participate in cross-team process improvement to ensure business applications are effectively integrated  
Prepare test plans and support documentation
Lead planning workshops and project teams to capture and define technical requirements and data / information specifications
Contribute to planning processes
Prepare and deliver presentations and briefings as required
Provide management with status of projects 
Document data mappings for an integration solution; servicing department crown jewel application data to downstream consumers  
Skills and Experience:

Extensive experience as a Technical Business Analyst in a large complex IT environment
Proven ability to deliver complex user specifications and/or detailed business requirements
Experience working on enterprise digital solutions 
Experience in Learning Management System projects an advantage
Proven understanding of project and systems development lifecycles and project management and business analysis methodologies (e.g. PRINCE 2, CBAP, Agile).
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated ability to prioritise and deliver results in a fast paced, complex project environment.
Proven ability to track and report on deliverables.
Demonstrated strong relationship building skills with the ability to bridge both the business and ICT
Consultant: Colin Massey

Keywords: Technical Business Analyst, Business Analyst, BA, NSW government, digital, Agile, business process change, system change, requirements gathering, creation of user stories, data analysis, testing, data mapping, data transformations

Great things start here

RACV is on an exciting transformational journey, revolutionising the way we work and the products and services we offer our members and customers. Join us and be part of a workplace where you feel you belong. 

  

About the Opportunity

As a Senior Financial Systems & Modelling Analyst, you will be responsible for the effective and efficient delivery of the Oracle EPM or IBM Planning Analytics system. This system supports Group reporting, budgeting, forecasting models and finance business intelligence. You will oversee system architecture, maintenance, administration, security and user support. You will also ensure data integrity with source systems, develop financial models and reports and provide finance-related ERP and network access administration support services.

 

Your key responsibilities will be:

Maintain and administer the Oracle EPM or IBM Planning Analytics system, including backups, upgrades, system architecture, and user licence management

Develop and support financial models and reports for group reporting, planning, and forecasting

Ensure data integrity by updating finance data cubes, aligning with source systems, and managing access controls

Provide ERP finance administration support, including cost centre setup, reporting hierarchies, and month-end close activities

Manage network access controls for finance systems and shared drives

Deliver effective user support, resolve system issues, and coordinate IBM Planning Analytics training

Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external support providers to ensure systems meet RACV requirements

 

What you’ll need to be successful:

Essential:

Minimum 9 years’ experience supporting Oracle, IBM Planning Analytics or similar multi-dimensional database systems

At least 5 years’ experience writing code to deliver operational efficiencies

Minimum 2 years’ experience providing ERP finance administration support

Tertiary qualifications in IT, Finance or a related field

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel

Desirable:

Functional knowledge of finance operations including management reporting, planning, forecasting, general ledger accounting and consolidation

Advanced knowledge and use of the Microsoft Office 365 suite

Experience with SAP ERP

Familiarity with systems design

Project management experience
